page.title: 07Richmond, North Yorkshire. 1
page.content: {Richmond}in{North Yorkshire}is the mother of all the towns (70) of this name worldwide. Many tourists arrive in the town every year, drawn by the great scenic beauty of the surrounding countryside and by its cobbled market place and historic buildings. The{River Swale}( its name means a tumultuous flow) is the fastest flowing river in{England}. At the foot of the{Castle}there is a natural drop in the river bed making a 6ft water- fall. The large flat grassy field nearby, known as the{Batts}, attracts hundreds of picnickers and paddlers. The{Swale}is an anglers river. There are trout above and coarse fish below the falls. Over the{Green Bridge below{Earls Orchard}there is a sports and leisure field and modern pavilion. This was once a jousting ground for knights from the{Castle}. (continued)
